description: I use to run this in ubuntu mate 16.04 for the raspberry pi 3 and it worked fine. it has no sound output in 18.04
summary: It worked for 16.04 but not for 18.04

description: I love this app. I linked it with my Pandora account, and all my SiriusXM mirrored stations appear right before my eyes! Also, I noticed there's no adverts in-between songs. I don't know if this a part of Pithos blocking the adverts, but I'm free user, so I don't know really. Also @Dart, I think your sound card might be messed up. Try re-installing the drivers that are for your sound card, or try the troubleshooter. That's probably why you have no sound.

I've been using this app in one version or another for several years. I've seen some complaints about it not working on different distros but that's never been an issue for me. I'm currently running it on 4 different distros including 18.04 and 19.04 without a problem.

Needs option to repeat songs. And how about thumbs up and down buttons (instead of the current right click)? I also want to be able to create new stations, not just from one's i'm currently listening to. But i guess i can do that from the browser too. This app is only good for listening to a station you already have set up. Seeing which songs will play in advance is a nice touch though.

I have been using pithos for around 10 years and it never disappoints. No ads, unlimited skips, shows you upcoming songs so you can skip ahead to one you want, integration with the OS so media controls work, pauses on screen lock.
Very Convenient for everyday listening on headphones

Started playing my favorite songs immediately upon sign in. I'm very excited. 

THANK YOU!!
works great. I like that I can hide the app and "Like" songs from the notification tray. simple and effective

I have been using this app for years and love it! I flip it on and let the songs roll in the back ground and enjoy tunes while I work. Sure we get the occasional advertisement from Pandora but that's ok by me.
summary: An essential for folks who like Pandora

description: Awesome job. I only wish that the GUI was more sophisticated, with shortcut support, so that I could "love" or "ban" songs without going back and forth to the app.
There's an updated version, 1,4.0, on github: https://pithos.github.io/
Works perfectly.
Just installed in 19.04 on a low-spec machine. Uses 60% less ram while streaming than Firefox just sitting open. Pretty good. Intuitive interface.
great. loving it. nice lite theme that does exactly and only what it is supposed to.
I was unsure about it at first, however I am convinced. I would recommend this app to everyone that will listen to me! It is Awesome!!
summary: Great App! It streams perfectly when you need it

description: My first time downloading
Pithos kept playing when I Xed out of the app. Restarted to try to get it to stop, but then the X wouldn't do anything, even if I first paused the music.

Works without any config on my part in Ubuntu and Lubuntu. 
Been using this since about 2015.

I have been using Pithos for a while now, not sure how long but a long time. Until recently it has always worked without incident. I recently changed my Imac to Ubuntu and installed Pithos and it did have some problems but they seem to be fixed now.
I just installed in on 18.04 and works, quick and easy. Got rid of windows 10 for my HTPC and installed 18.04 and was delighted that this app was available.
All the stuff you love about Pandora without the stuff you dont. Lightning fast

Ubuntu 19.10
I downloaded the app and it works great. Perfect for studying and I don't want to open the browser.

I've been using it for a few years now and like dealing with it better than having a Firefox tab opened. I wish there was better Pandora One integration, though and better randomization of the song queues.
The fact that it pulls from all my stations makes this ideal for me.
This is such a good little app. Works well for me. Only thing i wish it had was transparency and a dark mode.

I've been using this app for several hours for the last couple of days. Even though I only have a basic Pandora membership, I haven't had to listen to a single ad. Music has played without any hesitation. Well done!
summary: Works better than using Pandora's own website

description: Pithos is easy to use and perfect for the pandora listener. I have been using it for years now -- still my favourite. Has always worked without any issues.

Description is spot on, lightweight and easy setup. Plus no commercials. I also like that it pre-loads the a few songs at a time so you can see ahead rather than gambling on skipping a song you don't like. :P
Thank you very much. Much appreciated. God bless you, bless this wonderful project.
summary: Strongly recommended for all Ubuntu users

description:
Sound quality through Pithos is very, very poor - terrible actually. Listening to Pandora through the browser works great, but Pithos is so bad I can't even listen to it. Poor fidelity to start with (like below 96KBps) with lots of chopping out, clipping, and distortion. As soon as I switch back to any browser - crystal clear again. 

I appreciate the developer's hard work and contribution to the community, but this unfortunately is unusable.
Installed on Fedora 34 and Ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS; works great on both. Does exactly what it says: lightweight, out of the way, Pandora player with nice features and great sound quality.
summary: Works great, sounds great, easy to use

description:
Works well, except I noticed that the sound turns off when you lock the screen. This is a major issue for me, since I am running it on a laptop and I want to be able to lock the screen and have it go blank to save battery while I play music on Bluetooth.

The pandora web app works without any issue when the screen is locked.

I do love this app, as it is simple and doesn't let ads play from pandora. I love it. Recently, i had it open and put the computer into standby for the night. Next day, i tried to play it and i get "Pandora returned an error, An unexpected error occurred (code 0)". I am not sure what is going on, i have tried reinstalling the app, but nothing. I have found a ticket on pandora community page about sort of same problem and looks like they might not be allowing linux apps for access. Maybe it is just me, but i can't log in on the app anymore.... very sad.
summary: Nice app, but recently not working

description: perfect app. I using this ap several years

Pithos having issues lately, intermittently not playing, unable to retrieve songs... "Retry". Uninstalled, reinstalled... meh. Just upgraded to Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS today... now Pithos only plays 1 song and stops. The song timer stops long before the song does. I love Pithos, please fix it.
It's a good app, problem is it doesn't auto forward to the next song. I have to manually click the next song.
Genius app. Love it
Вообще не интересуют онлайн радио, где нужно регистрироваться.
